comment.text: Sodium-independent transporter of chloride and iodide.
Localizes to the apical brush border of cells in the cortical collecting ducts of the kidney.
High expression in adult thyroid, lower expression in adult and fetal kidney and fetal brain. Not expressed in other tissues.

disease.name: Pendred syndrome
disease.description: An autosomal recessive disorder characterized by congenital sensorineural hearing loss in association with thyroid goiter. The disorder may account for up to 10% of the cases of hereditary deafness. The deafness is most often associated with a Mondini cochlear defect. Deafness occurs early, starting at birth or during the first years of life. It is bilateral, sometimes asymmetrical, fluctuant and often progressive. Thyroid perturbations, such as thyroid goiter and/or hypothyroidism appear most commonly during adolescence, but they can be congenital or appear later.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Deafness, autosomal recessive, 4
disease.description: A form of non-syndromic sensorineural hearing loss. Sensorineural deafness results from damage to the neural receptors of the inner ear, the nerve pathways to the brain, or the area of the brain that receives sound information. DFNB4 is associated with an enlarged vestibular aqueduct.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the SLC26A/SulP transporter (TC 2.A.53) family.

feature.description: In PDS; fails to localize to cell membrane; abolishes iodide transport.
In DFNB4 and PDS; does not affect protein localization to cell membrane; does not affect iodide transport; dbSNP:rs145254330.
In PDS; fails to localize to cell membrane; abolishes iodide transport; dbSNP:rs111033199.

In PDS; retains residual transport function.

In PDS; retains residual transport function.
In PDS; partially affects protein localization to cell membrane; abolishes iodide transport; dbSNP:rs111033309.
